title: China’s most audacious Chelsea plunge yet
text:
Blues edge closer to history 0:49 Chinese Super League club Tianjin Quanjian targeting Diego Costa with monster $137 million bid 21 minutes ago by Staff Writers Source: FOX SPORTS CHINESE Super League club Tianjin Quanjian are planning an audacious £80 million bid for Chelsea star Diego Costa, according to the Sun. 
Chelsea reportedly rejected a £50m offer from Tianjin, who are managed by Fabio Cannavaro, last month. 
But it appears the CSL club just won’t go away, with an offer that would see Costa earn a remarkable £480,000 per week. Diego Costa. / AFP PHOTO / Ian KINGTON Source: AFP 
“Costa’s agent Jorge Mendes was working on the deal for Tianjin but Chelsea have said ‘no’ to the bid,” a source told SunSport. 
“It was around £50m and the wages of £480,000-a-week would have put him among the highest earners in the world. 
“At the moment, the club are seriously thinking about going back in with a much improved offer. They’re thinking about £75m would be more than right for a player of his age. 
“Costa is Brazil-born and the Chinese believe Brazilian footballers are best suited to their league. The division is full of them. Hulk, Oscar, Paulinho, Alex Teixeira and Ramires are to name only a few out here.” 
Chelsea recently profited from the sale of midfielder Oscar to CSL club Shanghai SIPG for £52m, while Ramires headed to Jiangsu Suning in January 2016 for around £25m. 
Costa was reportedly interested in a move to China last year before Antonio Conte chose to hang on to the striker, with that decision playing dividends through the Spaniard’s top form this season.
